abstract: Op-Ed article by security specialist Christopher Soghoian contends safety of anonymous news sources depends not only on journalists' ethics, but on their use of secure-communication tools; warns as governments increasingly record their citizens' every communication, news media should look to WikiLeaks, with its spectacular operational computer security, as a beacon of best practices.
snippet: Often, anonymous sources have been exposed by a journalist’s use of insecure communications.
lead_paragraph: Often, anonymous sources have been exposed by a journalist’s use of insecure communications.

headline.main: When Secrets Aren’t Safe With Journalists
headline.print_headline: When Secrets Aren’t Safe With Journalists
headline.seo: Without Computer Security, Sources’ Secrets Aren’t Safe With Journalists
